searchsort

Class SortableBar

  • java.lang.Object
    • searchsort.SortableBar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable, Constants

    public class SortableBar
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable, Constants
    this class is the core data element in the SearchSort program. It is a bar with five values: top, bottom, red, green, and blue; each of which is a percentage, effectively +/- 0.1%. There are also two other attributes, size (found by the difference between top and bottom) and brightness (found by the sum of the rgb components). The bar is capable of displaying itself at a given location, if it is passed a graphics object, but it does not maintain information about location.

    The SortableBar has five static variables. They are:

    1. Current_Comparision_Type, which keeps track of which of the aforementioned attributes will be used in compareTo and equals.
    2. Bar_Width, accessed by the panel that draws this Sortable bar, so that we don't need to tell each bar individually how wide it is, and
    3. Max_Bar_Height, also used by the panel drawing these bars for the same reason. The bars will not likely be this height, but some percentage of it.
    4. Invert_Order, a boolean indicating whether compareTo() results should be inverted, allowing lists to be sorted largest-to-smallest.
    5. compareCount, the number of times the compareTo() method has been called.

      • Fields inherited from interface searchsort.Constants

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SortableBar()
      by default, creates a bar with random values.
      SortableBar(double inBottom, double inTop, double inRed, double inGreen, double inBlue)
      creates a specific SortableBar, based on the included information, all of which must be between 0.0 and 1.0.
      SortableBar(SortableBar source)
      creates a new SortableBar that is a copy of the source.
      SortableBar(java.lang.String sourceString)
      accepts a tokenized string of four doubles (separated by the "\" token) to create this SortableBar.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int compareCount()
      gets the number of times that compareTo() has been called.
      int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
      returns a negative number, zero, or a positive number, based on whether this SortableBar is less than, equal to, or greater than the parameter SortableBar; this comparison is based on what value is in the static field CurrentComparisonType.
      boolean deepEquals(SortableBar other)
      behaves like the equals() method, but compares all the attributes of this SortableBar with the given one.
      void drawSelfAt(java.awt.Graphics g, int x, int y)
      draws a rectangle for this box with a lower left corner at (x, y), based on the fields of this SortableBar and on the static fields Max_Bar_Height and Bar_Width, which must be defined once before you call this.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      overrides the equals() method to follow the "compareTo" methodology.

      • makeTargetSortableBar

        public static SortableBar makeTargetSortableBar(double searchValue)
        creates a sortableBar that can be used in comparisons to find a bar with the given value in the currentComparisonType.
        Parameters:
        searchValue - - the number to search for
        Returns:
        a dummy SortableBar with its currentComparison value set to the searchValue.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
        returns a negative number, zero, or a positive number, based on whether this SortableBar is less than, equal to, or greater than the parameter SortableBar; this comparison is based on what value is in the static field CurrentComparisonType. If the Static variable "Invert_Order" is true, then this method throws the opposite, so that a greater numerical value will be considered smaller.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the parameter object is not a SortableBar.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the parameter object is null.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        overrides the equals() method to follow the "compareTo" methodology.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
